Detailed Description

DrmRightsObject is a binary representation of DRMREL specified OMA DRM Rights Object. Each DrmRightsObject can has a UID and a set of DrmPermissions according to OMA DRM. Beside UID each DrmRightsObject also has a device local unique ID. This ID can be used to easily access and reference the rights objects. Rights object with same UID will also have same local ID.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN DrmRightsObject::AddPermission (  const DrmPermission &  perm  ) 
 

Adds a permission object to the rights object. Currently OMA DRM defines 4 different types of operations (play, display, execute, and print. Therefore not more than 4 permissions can be added to a rights object. Permission must not be of the same type as already existing permission objects.

Returns:
TRUE on success, FALSE on error

INT DrmRightsObject::OnContentConsumedEnd (  DrmOperation  op  ) 
 

If content has been consumed, OnContentConsumedEnd will update constraint internal state.

Parameters:
op Operation which consumes content
Returns:
TRUE on update of internal constraint state

INT DrmRightsObject::OnContentConsumedStart (  DrmOperation  op  ) 
 

If content has been consumed, OnContentConsumedStart will update constraint internal state to indicate start of content consumption.

Parameters:
op Operation which consumes content
Returns:
TRUE on update of internal constraint state to indicate start of consumption

INT DrmRightsObject::OnRollback (  DrmOperation  op  )

op Operation which consumes content
Returns:
